definition: variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: It's very long. I think it's three hours long.
sentences.chinese: 這齣戲很長，大概有三小時。

sentences.english: The play climaxed in the third act.
sentences.chinese: 那齣戲在第三幕達到高潮。

sentences.english: Emilia is the voice of conscience in the play.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉亞在這齣戲中是良知的代言人。

sentences.english: The play has a powerful ending.
The play the causes and effects of logical relationship is roughly such.
sentences.chinese: 這齣戲的前因後果邏輯關係大致是這樣的。

sentences.english: The play did not take in this city.
sentences.chinese: 那齣戲在這個城市不賣座。

sentences.english: Luckily the strength of the piece did not depend upon him.
sentences.chinese: 幸好這齣戲並不靠他來撐場面。

sentences.english: By popular demand, the play will run for another week.
sentences.chinese: 應廣大觀衆要求，這齣戲將加演一週。

sentences.english: We're too late to see the play.
sentences.chinese: 太晚了，我們已經看不成那齣戲了。

sentences.english: There'll be a further performance of the play next week.
sentences.chinese: 這齣戲下星期將加演一場。

sentences.english: When the play opened, the local pre gave it the thum down.
sentences.chinese: 這齣戲上演後，當地報紙評價很低。

sentences.english: Not behind closed doors, and so on with Initiative and Jiang Kui.
sentences.chinese: 閉門不齣，與姜夔等相倡和。

sentences.english: The play climaxed in the third act .
sentences.chinese: 那齣戲在第三幕達到高潮。

sentences.english: Well put on a children play at the end of this month.
sentences.chinese: 我們在月底將上演一齣兒童劇。

sentences.english: She is headlining in the new play.
sentences.chinese: 她在這齣新戲裏演主角。

definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
script for play, opera, movie etc/screenplay/scenario
A Dream of Red Mansions (first completed edition 1791) by Cao Xueqin 曹雪芹[Cao2 Xue3 qin2], one of the four great novels
